title: You cannot serve both God and Mammon, but you can serve Mammon by predicting who will serve God
summary:
Key ideas:
- Papal election prediction markets still function despite a ban from Pope Gregory XIV.
- InTrade is banned by the US government for “protecting market integrity”.
- PaddyPower is significant for papal prediction markets and offers a bonus offer to refund losing bets if the next Pope is black.
- There is no easy way to bet against the proposition that the next Pope’s name will be Pope Peter II.

Key learnings:
- Papal election prediction markets exist and are popular.
- Betting markets may take advantage of maximum refundable bets to limit their losses.
- The ban on prediction markets may not deter everyone from using them.

Key questions:
- What other ways are there to make guaranteed money from the Papal betting markets?
- Could InTrade create a next papal name betting market?
- Are there any loopholes in the ban on prediction markets that could be exploited?
